title: Pub and shop staff: 'Please be nice to us this weekend'
description: Newsbeat hears from staff heading back to work after four months away.

title: Cinema and big event organisers targeted by extreme anti-vax activists
description: Large events are going ahead this weekend as part of trials to reopen the economy, but some are receiving hate for participating.

title: Hijab regulations: Two women's experience
description: Nadya and Emna live 12,000 km away from each other but both have been told what they can and can’t wear.

title: Nepal fires: 'We saw huge flames coming towards our garden’
description: This year’s wildfire season in Nepal has been worse than usual with more fires, burning longer.

title: On the front line in eastern Ukraine
description: The BBC's Jonah Fisher reports from the front line between soldiers and separatists.

title: 20 years in Afghanistan: Was it worth it?
description: The BBC's Frank Gardner asks the awkward question about a war with an astronomical human cost.

title: Sputnik V: How Russia's Covid vaccine is dividing Europe
description: The vaccine has not yet been approved by Europe's medicines agency but orders are piling in.

title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 April 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Nasa chooses SpaceX to build Moon lander
description: SpaceX will build a lander that the US space agency will use to return humans to the Moon this decade.

title: Raúl Castro steps down as Cuban Communist Party leader
description: His resignation ends his family's six-decade hold on power in Cuba.

title: Prince Philip: Queen shares one of her favourite photos
description: Released on the eve of the duke's funeral, it shows the couple relaxing in the Scottish countryside.

title: Covid: Canada sounds the alarm as cases overtake US
description: Infections in the largest province could increase sixfold without tougher measures, experts warn.

title: Reopening verdict: 'It was 'buzzing, chaotic and crazy'
description: Business owners tell how their first week of trading has gone after lockdown rules eased in England and Wales.

title: In Pictures: Helen McCrory's acting career
description: A look back at the characters portrayed by the British actress, who has died aged 52.

title: Helen McCrory: Peaky Blinders actress dies aged 52, husband Damian Lewis says
description: The star, who has died of cancer, was a "beautiful and mighty woman", her husband Damian Lewis said.

title: Covid: Art and challenges keep Para athlete on track
description: Tom Wilson, who has cerebral palsy and is profoundly deaf, has not let the pandemic hold him back.

title: Covid-19: Pandemic funeral services not what people 'deserve'
description: Gary Stewart's wife Jude died in January, but the pandemic meant restrictions on the funeral service.

title: Prince Philip: How can Prince Harry attend the funeral?
description: The Duke of Sussex has returned to the UK for the first time since "stepping back" from royal duties.

title: Muckamore Abbey Hospital: Seven to face prosecution
description: They were reported to prosecutors for offences including the alleged ill-treatment of patients.

title: Sarah Everard: Woman arrested over disappearance has bail extended
description: Two post-mortems have been carried out on Sarah Everard's body but a cause of death has yet to be released.

title: Hong Kong: Jimmy Lai sentenced to 14 months for pro-democracy protests
description: Jimmy Lai, the owner of Hong Kong’s last opposition newspaper, is a fierce critic of Beijing.

title: Smalling and family robbed at Rome home by armed men
description: Roma defender Chris Smalling and his family were victims of an armed robbery at their home in the early hours of Friday.

title: Greensill: Ex-Civil Service boss 'baffled' by business links
description: Lord Kerslake says links between Greensill Capital and the government must be "thoroughly investigated".

title: Prince Philip funeral 'a profound chance for Queen to say goodbye'
description: The Queen will show the "extraordinary courage she always does", Archbishop Justin Welby says.

title: England's Stokes to have surgery and miss New Zealand Tests
description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes will be out for up to 12 weeks after it was determined he would need surgery on a fractured finger.

title: Matt Hancock owns shares in NHS-approved firm
description: The health secretary is accused of "cronyism" but the government says he acted "entirely properly".

title: Ocado in self-driving vans push with £10m stake in Oxbotica
description: The online grocery retailer has teamed up with Oxford self-driving firm Oxbotica.

title: Land Rover hearse designed by Prince Philip unveiled
description: The Duke of Edinburgh oversaw modifications to the car, which will carry his coffin at Saturday's funeral.

title: Student's heart failure linked to 'excessive' energy drinks
description: The 21-year-old university student spent 58 days in hospital, including in intensive care.

title: St Vincent volcano: ‘A horrifying 72 hours’
description: Musician Dan Caplen is in Saint Vincent and shows the impact of the recent volcanic eruption.

title: 'Solskjaer wouldn't go against the players' - Pogba criticises Mourinho management style
description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba says current boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer "wouldn't go against the players" like former manager Jose Mourinho.

title: Indianapolis mass shooting: Eight dead at FedEx facility
description: Many people are also injured as a gunman opens fire at a FedEx site before reportedly killing himself.

title: 'I'm in a set of squats & I'm bawling my eyes out' - Shiffrin on pain of father's death
description: Alpine skier Mikaela Shiffrin's beloved father died in 2020, and it's given her a change in perspective before Beijing 2022.

title: 'Whitest ever' paint reflects 98% of sunlight
description: Researchers hope their "ultra-white" paint can save energy by reflecting sunlight from buildings.

title: Adam Toledo: Chicago police release video of officer shooting boy
description: Bodycam footage shows an officer shouting "drop it" before fatally shooting Adam Toledo in the chest.

title: Titanic: Searching for the 'missing' Chinese survivors
description: When the Titanic sank, six Chinese men were rescued - but their ordeal didn't end there.

title: Prince Philip: How deaths of public figures can affect others
description: Many were saddened by the death of the duke but why do people grieve over those they have never met?

title: Concrete to cobbles: Can a city centre go back in time?
description: Does a half-demolished eyesore shopping centre give a city a unique opportunity to turn back time?

title: Scottish election: How independence could be key to how people vote
description: The BBC’s Connor Gillies takes a look at how the upcoming elections in Scotland could affect the likelihood of an indyref2.

title: Why was Prince Philip born on this dining table?
description: A lesser known fact about the Duke of Edinburgh is he was born on a dining table in Corfu. But why?

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Brothers apart' amid Queen's 'final tribute'
description: The Duke of Edinburgh's funeral plans - and the choreography of the procession - make the front pages.
